dashboard.header.title: Today, start by taking care of your own choices.
dashboard.header.subtitle: Among all the outside expectations, which ones truly belong to you?
dashboard.quick.title: Control overview
dashboard.quick.hint.high: You tend to take control — remember you can also lean on others.
dashboard.quick.hint.mid: You are balancing control and letting go quite well.
dashboard.quick.hint.low: You often choose acceptance — you might try a bit more proactive action.
dashboard.insight.title: Today's insights
dashboard.insight.distribution: Task distribution: {{mine}} mine, {{shared}} shared, {{theirs}} others' tasks
nps.title: Would you like to share some feedback?
nps.subtitle: From 0 to 10, how likely are you to recommend Unload to a friend or colleague?
nps.placeholder: Anything you especially liked or felt could be improved? (optional)
newTask.step1.title: What is happening?
newTask.step1.subtitle: Choose the option that best matches your current situation.
newTask.step2.title: What is this situation making you worried about?
newTask.step2.subtitle: Choose the external factors that fit best.
newTask.step3.title: In the end, who carries the result of this situation?
newTask.step3.subtitle: From here, let's practice task separation.
newTask.step4.title: How much control do you have over this situation?
newTask.step4.subtitle: What parts can you influence, and what is beyond you?
newTask.step4.hint1: If your control is around 0-20%, it is mostly the other side's task (e.g. company process, final hiring decision).
newTask.step4.hint2: If it is between 20-60%, it is a shared task (e.g. interview interaction, clarity of communication).
newTask.step4.hint3: If it is above 60%, it is more about your own task (e.g. preparation, applications, direction you choose).
newTask.error.controlInvalid: The control level doesn't match the suggested range. Please adjust before submitting.
newTask.result.title: Task created
newTask.result.subtitle: You've completed the first step of clarifying your situation.
newTask.result.feedback.low: You identified the task "{{category}}", and your main concern is "{{worry}}". With control at {{control}}%, many factors are beyond you. Accepting what you cannot change can ease unnecessary anxiety.
newTask.result.feedback.mid: You identified the task "{{category}}", and your main concern is "{{worry}}". With control at {{control}}%, this is a shared task. The key is to focus on what you can influence and communicate with the people involved.
newTask.result.feedback.high: You identified the task "{{category}}", and your main concern is "{{worry}}". With control at {{control}}%, this is mostly your task. You hold most of the agency here - it may be time to lay out a concrete action plan.
newTask.result.reflection.low: Which parts of this task are truly outside of your control? What would it feel like to accept them?
newTask.result.reflection.mid: For this shared task, how could you communicate or collaborate with the other side more effectively?
newTask.result.reflection.high: You already hold most of the control. What is one action you're ready to take next?
wizard.maxSelections: You can select up to {{count}} options.
taskCategory.Interview_hint: For example: job interviews, internal role changes, performance reviews where you're worried about how you'll do.
taskCategory.CareerPlanning_hint: For example: not knowing your next career step, thinking about changing jobs, grad school, or switching fields.
taskCategory.SelfConfusion_hint: For example: feeling unclear about your strengths, interests, or values – not quite sure who you are or where you're heading.
taskCategory.ProgressAnxiety_hint: For example: project deadlines, job search progress, or learning goals that feel behind your expected timeline.
taskCategory.ExpectationPressure_hint: For example: expectations from family, managers, or peers that make you feel you must live up to a certain standard.
taskCategory.FinancialPressure_hint: For example: unstable income, rent or loans, or family financial responsibilities that make money feel very tight.
taskCategory.MarketChange_hint: For example: layoffs, industry downturns, AI or new technologies changing how work is done.
taskCategory.Other_hint: If none of the above fit, you can describe the situation in your own words.
taskWorry.Performance_hint: Worried you won't perform well enough, might make mistakes, or fall short of expectations (e.g. in an interview or presentation).
taskWorry.Rejection_hint: Afraid of being turned down, ignored, or having your ideas rejected (e.g. job applications or proposals).
taskWorry.OthersThoughts_hint: Concerned about what others think of you for example, being seen as not capable, not hardworking, or not fitting in.
taskWorry.Pressure_hint: You look fine on the surface, but feel a long-term sense of tension, fatigue, or emotional heaviness with no clear single cause.
taskWorry.Comparison_hint: Often comparing yourself with peers, colleagues, or classmates and feeling like you're falling behind.
taskWorry.TimeStress_hint: Feeling like there's never enough time, your schedule is packed, or you're worried you can't juggle all your roles.
taskWorry.Decision_hint: Getting stuck between options, afraid of choosing wrong or missing a once-in-a-lifetime chance.
taskWorry.Uncertainty_hint: Feeling unsure about your future direction, job stability, or life path – the road ahead looks blurry.
taskWorry.Other_hint: If your concern is more unique, you can describe it in your own words.
owner.Mine_hint: For example: how much you prepare, which actions you take, or whether you reach out for help – things mostly up to you.
owner.Theirs_hint: For example: company decisions, the other person's emotions and choices, or the overall economy – things you can't decide alone.
owner.Shared_hint: For example: collaboration on a project, communication quality, or relationship patterns that usually need both sides to adjust.
control.description.theirs: This is mostly the other side's task; there is only so much you can directly change.
control.description.shared: This is a shared task - both you and the other side play a part.
control.description.mine: This is mostly your task; your choices and actions strongly shape the outcome.
control.description.unknown: Please clarify who is mainly responsible for this situation first.
control.warning.low: Your control level ({{control}}%) is below the suggested range ({{min}}-{{max}}%). Take a moment to reconsider how much you can really influence here.
control.warning.high: Your control level ({{control}}%) is above the suggested range ({{min}}-{{max}}%). Take a moment to reconsider whether you might be taking on too much.

history.worry.label: Concern:
history.control.label: Control
history.empty.title: No matching records found
history.modal.title: Delete this record?
history.modal.message: This action cannot be undone. Are you sure you want to continue?
